intro: Hemianemia brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's hemianthus, is a rare aquatic plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and marshes. The plant has narrow, ribbon-like leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around its stem. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
